thread.title: Photo gallery: Natural History Museum of Utah holds third annual Indian Art Market
thread.title_full: Photo gallery: Natural History Museum of Utah holds third annual Indian Art Market

title: Photo gallery: Natural History Museum of Utah holds third annual Indian Art Market
text:
Published: Sunday, Oct. 11 2015 5:55 p.m. MDT Updated: 37 minutes ago Black Eagle talks about his artwork as the Natural History Museum of Utah holds its third annual Indian Art Market in Salt Lake City on Sunday, Oct. 11, 2015. Jeffrey D. Allred, Deseret News Summary 
Natural History Museum of Utah holds its third annual Indian Art Market Sunday, Oct. 11, 2015. 
Black Eagle talks about his artwork as the Natural History Museum of Utah holds its third annual Indian Art Market in Salt Lake City on Sunday, Oct. 11, 2015. The Indian Art Market is a juried show featuring the work of regional native artists. More than 20 selected artists were on hand to display and sell their original work ranging from jewelry, beadwork, sculpture painting and more. Attendees were able to meet the artists, learn about contemporary Indian arts and tribal culture, and take home something new and unique. Recommended Stories
